Diiv at Higher Ground

with Hello Mary

  • Nov 2, 2023
  • South Burlington, Vermont

I was on the fence of whether to go to this show or not because it would just be me and itâ€™s awkward standing by myself before the music starts. It was super awkward, although not as awkward as when I was younger. I must have grown a hair more comfortable in my own skin. But, damn Iâ€™m glad I went. When the band starts those feelings completely evaporated.

I didnâ€™t realize I was such a fan until hearing their how engrained their songs are in me. The [/diiv/arts-riot](Arts Riot) show in 2016 sent me over the edge into fandom, touring for their second album Is the Is are. I donâ€™t know many of the words. Theyâ€™re submerged into the music among guitar effects and echos, like other shoegazers. The foggy words make the actual words less important.

Like others in the genre, it was loud. I need to start wearing ear protection. So solid, so good.

The supporting act, Hello Mary, was an amazing three-piece in ironic camo. I tuned into this act, as they harmonized and appeared way to young to have such a decent sound and crowd control. They were a good combination for Diiv â€“ their buzzy bass primed us for the act to come.
